edu.northwestern.at.utils.corpuslinguistics.inputter
Class XMLTextInputter

java.lang.Object
  edu.northwestern.at.utils.IsCloseableObject
      edu.northwestern.at.utils.corpuslinguistics.inputter.XMLTextInputter
All Implemented Interfaces:
TextInputter
Direct Known Subclasses:
DiskBasedXMLTextInputter, SimpleXMLTextInputter
public class XMLTextInputter
extends IsCloseableObject
implements TextInputter

Text inputter which reads text from a TEI or EEBO XML file.

The XML file can be divided into smaller sections which are stored in a map. MorphAdorner uses a modified XGTagger interface to adorn each section of text separately, and then merge the results to produce the final adorned XML output.

Field Detail

segmentMap

protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> segmentMap
Map which holds segmented XML text.

The key is the segment name. The value is the segment data. The value may be something else in subclasses.

protected int textID
Text ID number for generated XML segments.

getSegmentText

public java.lang.String getSegmentText(int segmentNumber)
Returns specified segment of loaded text.

Specified by:
getSegmentText in interface TextInputter
Parameters:
segmentNumber - The segment number (starts at 0).
Returns:
The text for for the specified segment number, or null if the segment number is invalid. The returned text may be an empty string if the segment number is valid but the segment contains no text.
